column4: Whenever I open a file with totem movie player, it crashes. Can anyone help me with this?
I've tried mp3s, mpgs, WMV. They all cause it to crash.
I tried opening the same mp3 with XMMS and it works fine there. I don't have a different movie player to test the other files with.
I see the prob. Tried the same ones with xine, they play fine. I have the win32 codecs installed also. Maybe try another?
Michael: I didn't understand. You want me to try another what?
I get an error message (which I will copy in a moment)
Package totem-xine is not available, but is referred to by another package.
This may mean that the package is missing, has been obsoleted, or
is only available from another source
Is universe enabled in your sources?
Michael: I don't know how to find out.
then run apt-get update & then try for xine xine-ui
michael: I'd type "apt-get install xine xine-ui"?
When I try to install totem-xine, it says it has to remove ubuntu-desktop as part of the process. That sort of sounds dangerous to me...
Its just a small package, I have done that, no damage
Okay, totem isn't crashing anymore, but it's just displaying a blue screen instead of the video image. Where can I go for some codecs?
